en_us.tooltip.vampirism.garlic_diffuser_normal: A hunter gear that diffuses garlic in a %s by %s chunk area when placed, thereby weakening vampires unlucky enough to be nearby. The radius is quite small. So is the strength of the effect.
en_us.tooltip.vampirism.garlic_diffuser_weak: A hunter gear that diffuses garlic in a %s by %s chunk area when placed, thereby weakening vampires unlucky enough to be nearby. The effect is not too strong, but the substantial radius is worth it.
en_us.tooltip.vampirism.garlic_diffuser_improv: A hunter gear that diffuses garlic in a %s by %s chunk area when placed, thereby weakening vampires unlucky enough to be nearby. The radius is fairly average, but it's compensated by the stronger effect.
en_us.tooltip.vampirism.garlic_diffuser_core: A tightly rolled bundle of woolen fabric soaked in a garlic-based solution. Emits an aura acrid to vampires within a three-block radius. However, when properly heated inside a garlic diffuser, its true potential is unlocked, extending the effective range significantly.
en_us.tooltip.vampirism.candle_stick: An empty candle holder made for a single candle. Can be both placed down and hung on a wall. Right click with a candle of any color in hand to insert it.
en_us.tooltip.vampirism.candle_stick.filled: Illuminates your table with a dim candlelight. Can be both placed on a table and hung on a wall. Right click with empty hand to take the candle out.
en_us.tooltip.vampirism.candelabra: An empty candle holder made for three candles. Can be both placed down and hung on a wall. Right click with three candles of any color in hand to insert them.
en_us.tooltip.vampirism.candelabra.filled: Illuminates your table or the room with a warm candlelight. Can be both placed on a table and hung on a wall. Right click with empty hand to take the candles out.
en_us.tooltip.vampirism.chandelier: An empty candle holder made for four candles. Can be hung on the ceiling. Right click with four candles of any color in hand to insert them.
en_us.tooltip.vampirism.chandelier.filled: Illuminates the room with a bright candlelight. Can be hung on the ceiling. Right click with empty hand to take the candles out.
en_us.tooltip.vampirism.blood_grinder: Extracts blood from meat and other blood-rich consumables. In order to operate, it requires fabric filters, which are used up during the grinding process and must be replaced periodically. The raw material is supplied from the top of the block, whereas the filters must be inserted from the side either by hand or using contraptions such as hoppers. The result blood is then poured down into a container or extracted by pipes from below, if available. Alternatively, it can also be collected manually using buckets or bottles. Can be turned off using a redstone signal similar to hoppers.
en_us.tooltip.vampirism.blood_sieve: Converts blood from other mods into the blood from this mod. The input blood is accepted from the top of the block, either via containers or pipes if present in the mod pack, and is filtered afterwards. The fabric filters are gradually consumed in process and can be inserted from the side of the block either by hand or using contraptions such as hoppers. The result blood is then poured down into a container or extracted by pipes from below, if available.
en_us.tooltip.vampirism.fabric_filter: A tightly folded piece of fabric used to filter meat residues from blood. Primarily required by mechanisms like the blood grinder and the blood sieve. Wears out with use and must be replaced periodically.
en_us.tooltip.vampirism.blood_bucket: Obtainable by filling an empty bucket from a blood container. Can be poured on the ground similar to water or lava. When blood comes into contact with lava, netherrack is formed. If the flow touches blue ice, dark stone is generated instead.
en_us.tooltip.vampirism.mother_trophy: One of the souls absorbed by the Mother, deprived of all will in order to serve her, henceforth released, but forever unfree in this cage you call a trophy.
en_us.tooltip.vampirism.hunter_table: A small table for compiling material for the subsequent studies. Used to craft the hunter intel, requested by the hunter trainer for each level-up, along with payment. In order to craft the intels for higher levels, surround the table with additional hunter workstations such as the weapon table, the alchemical cauldron, and the potion table.
en_us.tooltip.vampirism.injection_chair:
A medical chair made specifically for injections. The hand restraints on the armrests ensure that the patient remains restrained during particularly hard moments.

Right-click while holding the injection to use it. Alternatively, you can sit on the chair and then apply it.
en_us.tooltip.vampirism.syringe_empty:
An empty syringe. Can be used to craft injections or to take blood from animals or other mobs.

Click on a mob to fill it with blood. It cannot be used on mobs that are low on blood, they will not be killed. One syringe can hold 50 mb of blood, which is one-fifth of a bottle. Blood can be poured into a bottle on a crafting table or directly into a fluid tank, such as the blood container, by right-clicking. Can be used via dispensers in a similar way to shears; the syringe will be filled and remain in the container.
en_us.tooltip.vampirism.syringe_blood: A syringe full of blood. Holds 50 mb of blood, which is one-fifth of a bottle. Blood can be poured into a bottle on a crafting table or directly into a fluid tank, such as the blood container, by right-clicking. An empty syringe will remain afterwards.
en_us.tooltip.vampirism.injection_garlic:
An injection of pale white serum  a substance extracted from garlic, the one which instills dread in creatures of night. It awakens and deludes what lies hidden behind the veil of the soul  and therefore remains the main enemy of the vampire nature, even that which is hidden within humans themselves.

Turns a human into a hunter. Right-click on the injection table to use.
Can also be applied to biteable creatures, such as animals or villagers, making their blood toxic for vampires for three in-game days.
en_us.tooltip.vampirism.injection_sanguinare:
An injection of a substance collected from vampire fangs. The plague itself lies dormant in its drops. The concentration is sufficient for the curse to break its trance and understand the host's true state.

Turns a hunter into a human, resetting all the progress. If used by a human, it infects them with sanguinare, but it takes notably less time for the plague to take effect. Right-click on the injection table to use.
en_us.tooltip.vampirism.vampire_blood_bottle: A bottle filled with vampire blood. Unlike human blood, it bears a faint purple tint and a thinner consistency. Might be flammable  best kept away from open fire. Can be obtained by killing vampires with a stake. Hunters value it as an alchemical reagent, often using it to brew stronger potions. Some hunters may charge such bottles as payment for training cadets.
en_us.tooltip.vampirism.stake: A lightweight wooden weapon that can be used to extract vampire blood from vampires. Recommended to be paired with a stronger weapon to weaken vampires, then finish them with the stake.
en_us.tooltip.vampirism.garlic_finder: Pure blood stirs more fiercely in the presence of garlic than the blood of inferior vampires. This device harnesses that peculiarity to estimate the proximity of garlic sources. Garlic diffusers and their cores within 40 blocks will be revealed to you if held in either hands or in the hotbar.
